topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Claire Vo’s background (CPO at multiple companies, founder, creator of ChatPRD) and previews major themes: AI’s impact on PMs, career agency, operating fast with high quality, and leadership topics.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Orb (usage-based billing) and Dovetail (customer insights conference Insight Out).

topics.title: Career progression: clarity, asking, making it easy
topics.summary: Claire shares her “secret sauce” for rapid growth: know what you want, ask clearly, and make it easy for leaders to say yes—illustrated by proposing an org chart and JD to take over marketing/growth.

topics.title: Promotion balance: timing, norms, and company needs
topics.summary: They discuss avoiding promotion-obsession by understanding promotion cycles and reframing asks around business problems (span of control, leverage) rather than personal ambition.

topics.title: Expanding scope: leading engineering and going sideways
topics.summary: Claire explains how she expanded into engineering and operations by targeting urgent company problems she could solve, and advises PMs to grow by moving left/right (e.g., marketing, ops) as a path upward.

topics.title: Avoiding overload: zone of genius and sustainability
topics.summary: Claire addresses the risk of being given “everything” by emphasizing operating in your zone of genius, ensuring work is energizing and sustainable, and protecting builder time through calendar/time management.

topics.title: Finding your zone of genius
topics.summary: Claire recommends an “energy audit” of your calendar to identify energizing work, plus asking what you uniquely do that others can’t; she cites her cross-functional fluency and ability to go from strategy to details.

topics.title: Moving fast at scale: clock speed and SLAs
topics.summary: Claire shares tactics for startup-like pace in larger orgs: don’t let meeting cadence dictate execution, pull timelines in “one click faster,” and maintain a fast personal SLA so leadership isn’t a bottleneck.

topics.title: Keeping a high bar: talent standards and candid feedback
topics.summary: Claire outlines building high quality via clear measurable expectations, normalized feedback (“clear is kind”), and acting quickly on misfits; she gives an example of bluntly resetting expectations for two leaders in conflict.

topics.title: Being a woman in tech: realities and leverage points
topics.summary: Claire discusses structural underrepresentation, why it’s not about imposter syndrome, and how curiosity plus empowerment helps her navigate ongoing bias; she shares the recurring experience of being questioned as “technical enough.”

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for Vanta (trust management, compliance automation, and Vanta AI for security questionnaires).

topics.title: Scrappiness and agency: selling her startup while pregnant
topics.summary: Claire tells the story of engineering her way into the right room (Microsoft experimentation day) to meet Optimizely leaders, demonstrating “bend the universe to your will” scrappiness and decisive deal-making late in pregnancy.

topics.title: The rise of the CPTO: combining product and engineering
topics.summary: Claire explains the CPTO role (product + engineering + design under one leader), why it may be increasing, and what it requires: real technical depth, operational rigor, org design skill, and attention to architecture and engineering performance.
